chargeHist.descr: 1st Degree Child Sex Assault - Sexual Contact with Person under Age of 13

result.execSummary:
The defendant Tristan M Horton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Child Enticement-Sexual Contact, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.07(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Submit DNA sample. $518 costs to be paid during first year. Maintain full-time employment or be receiving education or combination of both.  No contact with the victim or her family. No unsupervised contact with juveniles, not to be in company of persons under age 18 without adult supervision. Absolute sobriety at all times, not be on premises of establishments where alcohol is sold for on-site consumption. Comply with lifetime sex offender registration and follow all treatment recommendations. Admission to the crime during sex offender treatment. Comply with addtional assessments.

Huber granted under jail rules.

filed by the District Attorney's Office

Defendant Tristan M Horton in court with attorney Robert Franklin Nagel.  Clifford Chase Burdon appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court questioned parties. Counsels have received PSI and victim impact statement filed. Statement by attorneys Burdon and Nagel. Statement by defendant. Court addressed sentencing. Court withheld sentencing, placed defendant on 15 years probation. Conditions: 1 year jail commencing today at 7 p.m. Huber granted under jail rules. Submit DNA sample. $518 costs to be paid during first year. Maintain full-time employment or be receiving education or combination of both.  No contact with the victim or her family. No unsupervised contact with juveniles, not to be in company of persons under age 18 without adult supervision. Absolute sobriety at all times, not be on premises of establishments where alcohol is sold for on-site consumption. Comply with lifetime sex offender registration and follow all treatment recommendations. Admission to the crime during sex offender treatment. Comply with addtional assessments.11:15/12:05 p.m.

Defendant Tristan M Horton in court with attorney Robert Franklin Nagel.  Clifford Chase Burdon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Amended information filed.  Reading waived.  Rights/Elements.  Defendant pled no contest.  Court found guilty.  Judgment was entered.  PSI ordered by Court.  Due in 60 days.  Sentencing to be set by JA and Counsel.  Bond argument held.  Bond remains but defendant must remain in contact with atty Nagel on a weekley basis.  If this is not done atty Nagel is to contact the Court.  Must have contact every Friday by 4 pm.   10:10/10:25
